articles.summary: Dr. Abid Qaiyum Suleri has warned that Pakistan faces an escalating cycle of climate-induced floods. Pakistan, Nepal and India are equally vulnerable. The difference lies in preparedness, coping strategies and financial resilience, according to him.

articles.title: Dragonflies survived asteroids but may get wiped out by climate change
articles.author: Ashe Post
articles.summary: Global warming and intensifying wildfires are disrupting dragonfly mating patterns, threatening to push some species toward local extinction, according to the scientists.      Â   .   "Some species are being pushed toward extinction by global warming and wildfires."

articles.title: Climate scientists reveal exactly how many people in Europe DIED from heat-related causes in the summer ...
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Summer 2024 was Earth's warmest on record. In Europe, temperatures were 1.54°C (2.7°F) above the 1991-2020 long term average. Now, scientists reveal exactly how many people died due to the heat, which can trigger dangerous conditions.

articles.title: Government announces approval for Gatwick Airport expansion – Friends of the Earth reaction (Friends of the Earth Ltd)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Heidi Alexander has given the go-ahead to Gatwick Airport's second runway. Rosie Downes, head of campaigns at Friends of the Earth, is concerned about the impact of climate change on aviation emissions.    .   (http://www.foe.org.uk/news/gatwick-airport-second-linn-gave-the-go-ahead-to-gateswick-apartment-says-Rosie-Downes.

articles.title: 'Taken by Storm' challenges the consensus on global warming
articles.author: Natural News
articles.summary: In "Taken by Storm", Christopher Essex and Ross McKitrick argue that the widely cited 97 percent consensus on man-made global warming is misleads.    .   "There is no consensus on global warming" is misled.

articles.title: Is The Maldives Sinking? What Happens When A Country Sinks?
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: 80% of the Maldives lies less than one meter above sea level, putting the nation at severe risk from erosion and the looming threat of disappearing entirely. The Maldives is less than 1 meter above the sea level and is at risk of disappearing completely.

articles.title: Baxter's Response and Recovery Efforts Following Hurricane Helene (Baxter International Inc)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Hurricane Helene struck North Carolina in 2024. The hurricane's heavy rain surge triggered a levee breach, which led to water permeating North Cove's largest manufacturing plant and damaged the bridges that provide the plant's services. The plant is located at North Cove.

articles.title: Dragonflies survived asteroids but may get wiped out by climate change
articles.author: Talker
articles.summary: Scientists at the University of Colorado found that dragonflies with dark wing spots are disappearing from burned habitats and hotter regions across the United States due to climate change and intensifying wildfires. The research team says the study highlights an "underexplored" piece of conservation biology. Study co-author Dr. Michael Moore says the research underscores the urgency of rethinking wildlife management strategies.

articles.title: Peace through climate action
articles.author: Manik Esahak Biswas
articles.summary: The world observed International Peace Day on September 21 with a call for climate action for global peace. Peace in Bangladesh is not merely the absence of conflict. It is the presence of stability, the security of a home that will not be washed away, the guarantee of a livelihood that can withstand the next storm, and the promise of fresh water to drink and cultivate the land. The intensifying climate crisis presents a new threat to this peace. It acts as a silent agitator, exacerbating old tensions and creating new ones. It pits farmer against fisherman, displaces families from their ancestral lands, and strains the resources of our already crowded cities.

articles.title: UN climate leader urges action to match promises at Climate Week NYC
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: by | | Climate Change is a website dedicated to the study of climate change. For more information, visit: http://www.climatalkin.org/news/environment/environmental-change/chimatockexchange.html.
